meanings.definition: The quality or state of being volatile.
meanings.sent1: The volatileness of the situation made everyone nervous.
meanings.sent2: The volatileness of the chemicals in the lab required careful handling.
meanings.sent3: The volatileness of the puppy's behavior kept the family entertained.
meanings.sent4: The volatileness of the stock market can lead to unexpected gains or losses.
meanings.sent5: The volatileness of the weather in spring makes planning outdoor events tricky.

meanings.definition: The tendency to change rapidly and unpredictably.
meanings.sent1: The market's volatileness caused fluctuations in prices.
meanings.sent2: The volatileness of her moods made it hard to predict her reactions.
meanings.sent3: The volatileness of the game kept everyone on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent4: The volatileness of the political climate created uncertainty among voters.
meanings.sent5: The volatileness of the situation escalated quickly, catching everyone off guard.

meanings.sent1: The volatileness of the liquid allowed it to evaporate within seconds.
meanings.sent2: The volatileness of the perfume made its scent dissipate rapidly.
meanings.sent3: The volatileness of the mist disappeared as quickly as it appeared.
meanings.sent4: The volatileness of the alcohol in the solution made it ideal for quick drying.
meanings.sent5: The volatileness of the steam rising from the pot indicated it was ready to boil.
